definitions.definition: Facts or observations presented in support of an assertion .
examples: There is no evidence that anyone was here earlier.
We have enough cold hard evidence in that presentation which will make a world of pain for our parasitic friends at Antarctica.

definitions.definition: Anything admitted by a court to prove or disprove alleged matters of fact in a trial .
A body of objectively verifiable facts that are positively indicative of, and/or exclusively concordant with, that one conclusion over any other.

main_definition: Facts or observations presented in support of an assertion .
secondary_definitions: ( law ) Anything admitted by a court to prove or disprove alleged matters of fact in a trial .
A body of objectively verifiable facts that are positively indicative of, and/or exclusively concordant with, that one conclusion over any other.
